location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nawab Mirza Mehedy Ally Khaun, Native Resident, Bushire, to Emanuel Margotty, Captain of the HC Frigate Bombay

mods.abstract: Nawab Mirza Mehedy Ally Khaun [Mirza Mahdi 'Ali Khan Bahadur], Native Resident, Bushire, acknowledges the receipt of a letter, dated 13 December 1801, from Emanuel Margotty, which was written in response to the Resident's letter of the previous day [see f 4 2]. The Resident states that Samuel Manesty has written to him to say that if the Embassador [Ambassador] wants the services of the Bombay,then the packet should be forwarded in the same boat that brought it to Bushire. The Resident adds that the Embassador has informed him that he wants the Bombayto proceed to the Presidency in company with his own ship. The Resident opines that it will be some time before the Embassador will be ready to proceed, and he reiterates his concern that the boat that brought the packet to Bushire may be plundered again and the packet lost. However, he states that he is leaving it to Margotty to do whatever he thinks is best for the public service.
